instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck on Logo
threads.message:
i have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
stuck on logo, at the end of system loading, it start to have some black square on the screen

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck on Logo
threads.message:
Could be RAM, or CPU issue, because of black squares.
But do few PRAM restes first.
If no result, clean ME region in BIOS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck on Logo
threads.message: Going to be bad CPU RIP.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck on Logo
threads.message: what is clean ME region in BIOS ? and how to do it ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Stuck on Logo
threads.message:
Use search function on the forum.
You learn more this way than getting direct reply...
